reasons.title: Opportunity Zone Advantage
reasons.description: The site was acquired unlevered via a QOZB structure, offering significant capital gains tax benefits to investors.

reasons.title: Prime Campus Proximity
reasons.description: Located just one block from UC Berkeley, the project addresses a critical housing shortfall of approximately 27,000 beds.

reasons.title: Entitlement & Labor Edge
reasons.description: The project is fully entitled and exempt from Berkeley's new Hard Hats ordinance and PLA requirements, providing a significant cost advantage.

summary.quote: Notably, all large projects in Berkeley are now subject to PLAs or substantial community benefits. 2274 Shattuck is past all discretionary appeals and avoids these requirements.
paragraphs: 2274 Shattuck is a fully entitled 17-story student housing development located in the heart of Berkeley, California, just one block from the UC Berkeley campus. The project is designed for 227 units and 780 private beds, targeting the extreme housing shortfall currently facing the university. Developed via a Qualified Opportunity Zone Business (QOZB) structure, the project is uniquely positioned to offer investors substantial tax-efficient growth potential.

The project maintains a distinct competitive edge as it is past all discretionary appeals and remains exempt from Berkeley's Hard Hats ordinance and Project Labor Agreement (PLA) mandates that will slow future supply. The sponsorship team brings deep local expertise, having previously operated as the largest private student landlord at UC Berkeley prior to a landmark portfolio sale. Groundbreaking is targeted for Q2 2027 with pricing already secured from reputable contractors.
summary.conclusion: With entitlements finalized and a massive supply-demand imbalance in the student housing sector, 2274 Shattuck represents a high-conviction development opportunity.

cards.title: Financial Returns
cards.summary: Strong projected returns are supported by a high-density 17-story plan and a 7.8% untrended return on cost.

cards.title: Property Overview
cards.summary: A luxury high-rise development featuring fully furnished private bedrooms and high-end amenities adjacent to the UCB campus.

cards.title: Market Analysis
cards.summary: Berkeley faces a chronic housing deficit, further constrained by new labor ordinances that will significantly restrict future development.

cards.title: Sponsor Profile
cards.summary: Led by Patrick Kennedy, Panoramic Interests is a visionary developer with a 35-year track record of high-density innovation in Berkeley.

demographics.description: UC Berkeley total student body driving market demand
Estimated bed deficit despite recent deliveries

drivers.title: Severe Housing Shortage
drivers.description: Chronic undersupply of student housing with a ~27,000-bed deficit driven by ongoing UC Berkeley enrollment growth.

drivers.title: Supply Constraints
drivers.description: Berkeley's Hard Hats ordinance increases labor requirements, creating significant barriers to entry for new supply.

drivers.title: Transit Connectivity
drivers.description: Strategically located one block from UC Berkeley and walking distance to the Downtown Berkeley BART station.

drivers.title: Opportunity Zone Benefits
drivers.description: Site acquired via QOZB structure, offering substantial tax efficiency and capital gains advantages.

analysis.title: Occupancy Trends
analysis.description: Current market vacancy is exceptionally low at 4%, reflecting the inelastic demand from the student population.

analysis.title: Pipeline Update
analysis.description: New supply is expected to slow significantly due to increased construction costs and the Hard Hats ordinance.

analysis.title: Absorption Dynamics
analysis.description: Student enrollment at UC Berkeley continues to outpace new bed deliveries, widening the existing shortfall.

data.summary: The Berkeley market is characterized by a mix of high-density student housing and luxury multifamily developments. New supply (Hub Bancroft, The Standard) is commanding premium rents over $2,100 per bed for single occupancy, with established properties maintaining high occupancy due to the severe city-wide housing shortage.

sectors.title: Higher Education
sectors.description: UC Berkeley serves as the primary economic and demand anchor for the immediate vicinity.

sectors.title: Research & Science
sectors.description: Major research institutions like Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory provide high-income professional demand.

sectors.title: Technology
sectors.description: Emerging tech and startup ecosystem centered around the University and Downtown BART station.

paragraphs: Panoramic Interests is a Berkeley-based real estate development firm established in 1990 by Patrick Kennedy. The firm has a deep historical footprint in the Berkeley and San Francisco markets, specializing in dense, mixed-use, infill developments. From 2004 to 2007, Panoramic was the largest private landlord for UC Berkeley students, managing a portfolio that was ultimately sold to Equity Residential in 2007 for $146 million—the largest real estate transaction in Berkeley's history at the time.

The firm's 'More in Less' philosophy has led to numerous industry firsts, including the first independently accessed stacked parking lifts in the U.S. (1995) and the nation's first car-free high-rise micro-apartment building (2015). Currently, Panoramic is leveraging its 35 years of hyper-local expertise to develop 2274 Shattuck Avenue, a 17-story student housing project designed to address the university's chronic ~27,000-bed shortfall.

teamMembers.name: Patrick Kennedy
teamMembers.title: Owner / Principal
teamMembers.background: Patrick holds a J.D. from Harvard Law and a Masters in Real Estate Development from MIT. A pioneer of sustainable urban design, he has led Panoramic since its founding in 1990 and is a former member of the Carpenters and Steelworkers Unions.

teamMembers.name: JP Walsh
teamMembers.title: Partner
teamMembers.background: JP oversees financial, legal, and research efforts at Panoramic. He plays a key role in the capitalization and structuring of complex urban infill projects.

teamMembers.name: Michael Thomas
teamMembers.title: Director of Business Development
teamMembers.background: Michael leads land acquisitions, joint ventures, and project operations, ensuring the seamless execution of the firm's CITYSPACE® developments.

partners.name: West Builders
partners.description: Retained for pricing and preliminary construction estimates.
